title: Yeast Stress Responses During Mars Transit

sections.abstract: Yeast cultures were monitored to characterize transcriptional drift during simulated Mars transit radiation exposure.
sections.methods: Cryo-preserved cultures were cycled through radiation bursts and microgravity clinostat rotation while RNA-seq snapshots were collected.
sections.results: Stress response genes including MSN2/4 and HSP family members were upregulated with persistent ROS accumulation.
sections.conclusion: Long-duration transit missions require antioxidant supplementation and shielded storage to maintain yeast biomanufacturing stability.
